label: 今様
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 2:  Heian Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1999
説明文: One of the major secular vocal genre, which seems to have originated around the last quarter of the tenth century, and to have been fairly well known by the early eleventh.  The melodies were taken from a few favorite gagaku compositions, and many of the lyrics were adaptations fo simple Japanese Buddhist liturgical pieces (wasan) (p. 428). [雅楽、和讃]
